ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: My therapist and I understand each other
Notes: 1 = strongly disagree; 2 = disagree; 3 = neutral; 4 = agree; 5 = strongly agree

ElementDescription: We have established a good understanding of the kind of changes that would be good for me
Notes: 1 = strongly disagree; 2 = disagree; 3 = neutral; 4 = agree; 5 = strongly agree

ElementDescription: I feel that my therapist appreciates me
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = A little; 2 = Moderately; 3 = Quite a bit; 4 = Very much; 5 = Completely

ElementDescription: I believe the time my therapist and I are spending together is not spent efficiently
Notes: 5 = strongly disagree; 4 = disagree; 3 = neutral; 2 = agree; 1 = strongly agree

ElementDescription: I believe my therapist likes me
Notes: 1 = strongly disagree; 2 = disagree; 3 = neutral; 4 = agree; 5 = strongly agree

ElementDescription: What I am doing in therapy gives me new ways of looking at my problem
Notes: 1 = strongly disagree; 2 = disagree; 3 = neutral; 4 = agree; 5 = strongly agree

ElementDescription: I feel my therapist cares about me, even when I do things that he/she does not approve of
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = A little; 2 = Moderately; 3 = Quite a bit; 4 = Very much; 5 = Completely

ElementDescription: My therapist does not understand what I am trying to accomplish in therapy
Notes: 5 = strongly disagree; 4 = disagree; 3 = neutral; 2 = agree; 1 = strongly agree

ElementDescription: I am confident in my therapist's ability to help me
Notes: 1 = strongly disagree; 2 = disagree; 3 = neutral; 4 = agree; 5 = strongly agree

ElementDescription: I feel that the things I do in therapy will help me to accomplish the changes that I want
Notes: 1 = strongly disagree; 2 = disagree; 3 = neutral; 4 = agree; 5 = strongly agree

ElementDescription: My therapist and I trust one another
Notes: 1 = strongly disagree; 2 = disagree; 3 = neutral; 4 = agree; 5 = strongly agree

ElementDescription: I disagree with my therapist about what I ought to get out of therapy
Notes: 5 = strongly disagree; 4 = disagree; 3 = neutral; 2 = agree; 1 = strongly agree

ElementDescription: I believe my therapist is genuinely concerned for my welfare
Notes: 1 = strongly disagree; 2 = disagree; 3 = neutral; 4 = agree; 5 = strongly agree

Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = A little; 2 = Moderately; 3 = Quite a bit; 4 = Very much; 5 = Completely
